ui.description: A 28-item assessment measuring emotional awareness, regulation, empathy, and relationship skills

guide.ipipId: IPIP-EI-28 (Emotional Intelligence Assessment, based on Mayer-Salovey-Caruso Model)
guide.purpose: This assessment helps you understand your emotional intelligence level. It is for self-awareness only and not a diagnostic tool.
guide.instruction: Based on the last 2-4 weeks, honestly answer how much each statement applies to you.
guide.interpretation: Higher scores indicate higher emotional intelligence, while lower scores indicate lower emotional intelligence tendencies.

SA.name: Self-Awareness
SA.detail: Your ability to recognize and understand your own emotions. You accurately identify your emotional state and understand how it affects your behavior.
SA.tip: Regularly observe your emotions and try to find patterns in what situations trigger certain feelings.

SR.name: Self-Regulation
SR.detail: Your ability to manage and control your emotions in a healthy way. You don't get overwhelmed by negative emotions and respond in a balanced manner.
SR.tip: When emotions surge, pause and take a breath, or redirect your focus to another activity.

EM.name: Empathy
EM.detail: Your ability to understand others' emotions and perspectives. You can think from their viewpoint and recognize their feelings.
EM.tip: During conversations, pay attention to facial expressions, tone of voice, and body language.

RM.name: Relationship Management
RM.detail: Your ability to manage relationships effectively. You use emotional skills to create positive interactions with others.
RM.tip: In conflicts, try to acknowledge both the other person's and your own emotions in your communication.

items.text: I clearly understand what emotional state I'm in right now.
I can identify the causes of my emotions.
I understand how my emotions affect my behavior.
I know what situations cause me stress.
I don't notice changes in my emotional state.
I understand my strengths and weaknesses from an emotional perspective.
I rarely reflect on my emotions.
I can stay calm even when angry.
I recover quickly from negative emotions.
I don't act impulsively when emotions are high.
I can manage stress in a healthy way.
I struggle to control myself when emotionally overwhelmed.
When I make mistakes, I learn from them rather than blame myself.
I try to maintain a positive attitude even in difficult situations.
I can detect changes in others' emotions.
I can understand someone's feelings without them saying anything.
I try to see things from others' perspectives.
I tend to disregard others' emotions.
I can comfort others when they are sad or struggling.
I struggle to empathize with others' pain.
I try to understand different viewpoints.
I handle conflicts calmly and constructively.
I work to build trust in my relationships.
I communicate effectively and listen well.
I can motivate others.
I respect others when we have different opinions.
I frequently experience conflict in my relationships.
I understand others' needs and adjust my behavior accordingly.
I contribute to creating a positive atmosphere in groups.

ranges.title: Very Low
ranges.description: Your emotional intelligence is very low. You struggle to recognize and manage emotions in yourself and others.
ranges.recommendation: Try keeping an emotion journal or practicing meditation to observe your feelings more frequently. Working on active listening skills will also help.

ranges.title: Low
ranges.description: Your emotional intelligence is relatively low. You have room for improvement in emotional awareness and management.
ranges.recommendation: Record your emotional reactions and practice considering others' perspectives. Learning emotion regulation techniques can be beneficial.

ranges.title: Moderate
ranges.description: Your emotional intelligence is at a moderate level. You have basic skills in recognizing and managing emotions.
ranges.recommendation: Continue building on your foundation by deepening your understanding of your own and others' emotions.

ranges.title: High
ranges.description: Your emotional intelligence is high. You understand your emotions well and build effective relationships with others.
ranges.recommendation: Maintain your strengths and consider mentoring others in emotional awareness and regulation.

ranges.title: Very High
ranges.description: Your emotional intelligence is very high. You deeply understand emotions in yourself and others and manage them effectively.
ranges.recommendation: Use your high emotional intelligence to help others develop their emotional skills and awareness.
